name: RIDE
description: Bikes from the world's most beloved motorcycle manufacturers, breathtaking races, and a round-the-world trip taking in 15 different locations, all this and more in the new videogame: RIDE.

reviews.review_text: Do you like loading screens? Do you like random fps drops that will put you off an make you crash? Do you like racing the same 4 or 5 tracks with the same 4 or 5 gimmicky game modes?  All this an more in ride the game! 99/10

First of all the game looks nice. It presents a lot of options in terms of customization, but only just touches the surface in that area. The physics are below average. Bikes doesnt react to surroundings correctly, and the man himself desperately needs a ragdoll effect, which cant be that hard to make since we've seen that in lesser good games like Flatout, Flatout 2, Motocross game from 10-15 years ago. Milestone doesnt have any real competition on the Motorcycle game market and therefore do not feel the need to up their game at all. Same physics and controls as the last 2-3 MotoGP games. Poor network options - that rarely works, and when you succeed in connection to your friends, the game lags out and people disconnect with each other leaving you alone with bots.  The WORST thing about MotoGP through ALL the years and now also RIDE is the quality of sound. Computer sounds, made by what obviously must be people who havent heard the real thing IN REAL LIFE. The sounds these machines make are worse than car games 15 years ago. You have the rights to MotoGP, you dont have any competition - GO out and record the ♥♥♥♥ing machines to deliver it to us when we game it. Most of the purchases unfortunately done of this game, is by people riding a motorcycle, so we KNOW the sounds. My first machine was a Yamaha MT07 with an IXIL exhaust on. That doesnt exist in the game but Akrapovic does. Its looooud like a beast with Akra on IRL - but ingame it sounds like the engine sound comes from an iPhone.  Disgustingly bad :).  If you can come to terms with having to mute your game, because having no sound will annoy you less than having the sound on?! - then its STILL almost a waste of money.  Now RIDE 2 is on the way. People are ALREADY in the comments to RIDE's trailers and also RIDE 2's trailers writing 'WE WANT REAL SOUNDS' - if they ignore us, us being the ones who pay for the damn thing, one more time.... i HOPE it will have consequences. Or at least give another studio the ide to start making Superbike or MotoGP bike games again!

Is this game good? Yes... at sale price. The pros of this game is the basic gameplay, it's a really fun hybrid of arcade and sim that really nails the balance. It reminds me alot of the old MotoGP game from the early 2000s that leaned more towards sim racing. It has a good variety of bikes, could have used more tracks and variants to keep things fresh as you play. Now the problem is the content, it really isn't anything to write home about. It very much feels like a 90s game where gameplay was pretty much what you got. I'm comparing to modern racers where there is more than just racing. Think of that Gride game where there was a progression from season to season. Think of games like NFS shift (that this game borrows from a bit) where you had different categories you raced in. Yes you kind of have it in this where you race in different classes but it's not as well done. Think of how much customisation you get nowadays. Basically this is a nice game but quite bland. There aare still some bugs and glitches but nothign that broke gameplay or crashed the game for me. It's all just unpolished and could use more game modes and content.

I've read lots of reviews about Ride being unplayable; I had to agree with this at first, but after many tweaks and playing with settings I finaly got the game to run moslty trouble free.   I had the track detail set to about 3GB and the AA at 2x. with everythign else set to high. This setting seemed to work well and would jump between 30fps-48ish, with only a few tracks and sections of the game dropping to unplayable fps.   I recently installed windows 10 and tried the game again. with everythign set to high and AA at 2x ( for now ) I get a constant 50fps. have played about 7 races on different tracks and had no trouble at all. Defnitely an improvement.  The game itself is great. looks beautiful, bikes sound awesome and the game play is fun.   If you've had trouble with the game in the past, give it a go with windows 10 and see if that helps. I'm not saying it will make it better, but it appears that way on my system.   enjoy,  M  I ran the game using an fx 6300 / R9 290x, hopefully that helps you make a judgment on how it may run with your spec.

This game, is a real shame. It had such an oppurtunity to be a fantastic game, unfortunately, it's fallen flat on it's face.  Let me explain, now, Ride, as you might guess is a production motorbike racing game. Something I have been wanting for ages.   The problems start at the thing the game is about, motorbikes. Or the lack there of.   ***CONS***  - Now we have some bikes on here for sure, don't get me wrong. But we are missing some essentials. Hayabusa, ZXR1400, etc. The bigger bikes.   - The sounds of the bikes. Some are pretty good, others? Crap. I mean really, really bad. The 2 strokes? They sound like a smaller 4 stroke. Annoying.   - Stuttering, low FPS around corners. It runs at 60FPS constant until it suddenly decides to dip to around 10. Usually happens when going around corners.  RIG: Intel i5 4670K GTX 690 8GB 1866Mhz bla bla bla  - Sometimes you come off for no reason. It just happens. You'll be flung off your bike, for apparently no reason. No idea why, but you do.  - Menu's are not good. Pretty ugly, slow, not very well laid out.  - Small one, but very annoying for me, changing your exhaust doesn't effect the sound of the bike at all.  - The AI seem almost impossible to knock off, where as you come off very easily.  - The walls can sometimes just push you off your bike even if you aren't touching them.  - You cannot practise, or even qualify for a race. You are straight into it. This is so annoying.  - Not much customization for bikes. When you first play it, it seems like a lot. But then you realise, most of it is the same for every bike. I'd like more exhausts, own decals, racing fairing, that sort of thing.  But now the good bits.  ***PROS***  - The ability to change your ride style. How far you lean, how far you tilt your head, the lot.  - Being able to change your kit.  - There is nothing else like it. The closest is Tourist Trophy back on PS2.  TL;DR I don't like it.

Excellent expanding selection of current and historic sportbikes, attention to detail, managable learning curve, bike modifications, realistic tracks, good core game.  Overshadowed by stacked loading screens, game breaking exit-game issues, championship crashing, multiplayer ending bugs. Obvious quick port to PC. No social modules for chat, or user interface for mouse selections.  This one is a gem that needed more time being cut.  With hardly any competition in the 2 wheel market, a polished version of this might have cornered the whole niche.  Recommending with a large dose of 'It's far from perfect, but it has good potential.'

Very nice game, Although has a console feel that I really dont like that much (going between menus with bizarre loading times) The driving feel is very good. I played SBK X for a while and I liked that one as well, IF you've played a milestone bike game you should feel at home. Still some problems with the not so realistic feel of the bike sometimes, I mean a bike is VERY nimble in real life, you can lean from one side to the other very quickly : in this game you have to change suspension settings to get closer to reality, and you get negative effects from that (less stability). Still this is acceptable and you can have a lot of fun.  Does not have a lot of tracks at the moment, which is strange because they already had them in earlier games (in SBK X and previous moto GP games you had most popular tracks like brno, mugello, mazda raceway laguna seca etc.  A few open road tracks : need way more real open roads (and i mean not going in circles with laps, i mean a real road like there are sometimes in rally games)  Also city tracks , which I dont like so much (all 90° turn... it gets old)  Lots of bikes ! That's awesome. very well detailed, many categories like historical, naked, sportbikes, of all displacements.  Some groups are unbalanced for racing (you get MT07 or 696 pitted against a 848 , I think they should categorize in relation with horsepower instead of displacement.) Other example in supersport category: 600cbr, 636 ninja, MV agusta 800 3 cylinder : too much difference in hp  Wasn't very expensive so I got what a paid for but.. I really hope they develop on this base because it could very well be a wonderful title. I won't hesitate to buy DLC's to expand on it (bikes, tracks)  So.. why do I not recommend it ?  -Milestone is deaf and mute , PR is nowhere to be seen, many users have game breaking bugs and nothing happens -Loading screens are actually preventing me from launching the game right now, I mean it feels like playing playstation 1 back in the day

Despite all the negative reviews, I decided to give this a try..and boy, how wrong these reviews are is incredible!   When it comes to the bike models, the level of details and customization, it is a masterpiece. You will spend 80% of the first race just looking at your bike and be impressed, they look awesome! The bikers customization is also on par with many options and gear to choose from.   The sounds though..might use some improvements, but they are not as bad to force you stop playing.   The ingame options are limited to sound and hud, the rest is either managed by your GPU's control panel or the game's launcher.   Overall it is an ARCADE, don't expect super physics, feedback from the tires or anything that could make it feel more realistic or sim-like, it is 100% arcade. They clearly spent all the money on the licenses and the amazingly good looking models and left the gameplay and overall feels somwhere..far from the game xD.   I will list the things you will read the most in the negative reviews and try to explain/solve them if possible:   FPS drops - Yes, the drops were there when no fps lock was in place, from 120 to 80 on different areas on the same track. As this game is a console port you can't expect it to work over 60 fps without drops. Lock to 60 using your GPU's control panel and you will be fine. It NEVER dropped below 60 for me.    Long loading times - Lies. Got the OS on SSD and the game running from a 5900 rpms HDD and it takes like 15 seconds, sometimes less, to start racing.    Corrupt saves - As simple as backing up your save after each session. Yes, it is a pain in the ♥♥♥, but if you are a bike nurrrrd and like the game, you won't have any problems with doing a simple copy-paste.    Game keeps running in the background. Close Logitech's Profiler and problem solved.   Crash on loading screen. Don't press any buttons at all during loading screens and voila, no crashes.    Bad AI. I agree, to a certain point. The AI is not bad, it can be a real challenge, specially at the beginning, even more if you go with the Yamaha as your first bike, but from time to time they might act like you are not there, crash into you and force you to either finish in the last positions or restart. It is annoying, yes, but, you can simply avoid them by keeping your distance or using the rewind thingy to go back in time.    Xbox controller not working. I am guessing these people were using third party 'xbox' controllers and they did not work because the original one from MS works pefectly fine. In menus and in races.   For 9.99 € it is worth every cent.
